page.title: 03Parbold Hall
page.content: One of the area's most famous buildings is Parbold Hall, which was originally held by the Lathom family dating from the 13th. Century. The Lathom family fought on the side of the Royalists in the Civil War and lost their estates in 1651. The Hall was later bought by the Dicconson family of Wrightington Hall in 1791 and remained in the family until the 1930s. In 1802 the Hall became for a time the home of some Benedictine monks who had been sent out of France during the Revolution. In 1985, the Hall is owned by the Moores family who are nationally known as owners of the Littlewoods Pools and Mail Order Companies.
